title: West Side Story star Rachel Zegler announces social media after being called a 'homewrecker'
text:
After being called a 'homewrecker' by some fans, following some controversial remarks by her West Side Story co-star Ansel Elgort, Rachel Zegler is going on a social media break.

The 18 year old actress, who was plucked from obscurity, beating out over 30,000 girls to play Maria in Steven Spielberg's West Side Story, said on Thursday that she was taking an undetermined hiatus.

'The internet has made me upset so goodbye for a bit be nice to each other,' Zegler said in a tweet on Thursday afternoon.

Production on West Side Story wrapped last week, with the actress stating in a tweet on September 27, which was later deleted, gushing about her co-star Elgort.

'There really aren't enough words to describe the pride I have in Ansel's growth and beauty and literal magic he possesses on screen and off,' Zegler began.

'Falling in love with him was easy. Happy wrap mi amor. Catch you on a fire escape sometime,' Zegler concluded.

Just a few days later, Elgort, who has been dating his high-school sweetheart, Violetta Komyshan, on-and-off since 2012, said he was seeking an 'open relationship.'

'I'd like to find a lot more love,' Elgort said in an interview with The Times on Sunday.

'It doesn't need to be sexual. I think we've (Ansel and Violetta) been pretty clear that I want to feel free to fall in love with people and that [option] should be open, but sexually it can be closed off,' Elgort said.

The combination of Zegler's tweets and Elgort's interview seemingly lead fans to DM Zegler and call her a homewrecker, the actress said in a now-deleted tweet on Thursday night.

'The fact that i have to say something is absolutely absurd,' Zegler began, before addressing direct claims that she's a 'homewrecker.'

'But the DMs and the name-calling and throwing around the word homewrecker over me expressing genuine love i have for my coworker is heartbreaking and i don’t want any part of it. So peace for now, I guess. Be nice,' Zegler concluded.

She also jokingly tweeted about National Boyfriend Day, stating, 'Happy National Boyfriend Day I am so lonely,' before adding, 'JK I'm chillin.'

West Side Story is slated for release on December 18, 2020.
